title: Time Series Plot
x: Date variable to show dates on the x-axis
y: Y variable, select one or more variable(s) to plot
jitterPointsChk: Spread (jitter effect) the overlapping/crowded points for a group
angleXaxis_text: Angle to slant x-axis text values (default 0 for no slanting)
angleYaxis_text: Angle to slant y-axis text values (default 0 for no slanting)
labelDateAxisFormat: Date value formating if x-axis or y-axis has date values
dateUnitStr: A grouping date unit (e.g. day, week, month, year, etc) for the date values, if left blank, dates values will be auto-calculated
dateUnitInteger: (Optional) An additional grouping for date unit (e.g. '1 day', '2 week', '3 month', etc)
dateAxisFormat: Choose a format for the date value text
timeAxisFormat: Choose a format for the time value text
subSecondsFormat: Show sub seconds in the date time values on the axis
axisTickmarksCount: How many axis values (i.e. tickmark) to display (default 10)
subSecondsFormatTickmarksLocationChk: Show the sub seconds axis value on the exact locations when total data points is less than the total (default 10) axis tickmarks chosen
Facetwrap: Facet wrap (if chosen, any selection of Facet row and column will be ignored)
yIntercept: Enter comma separated Y intercept value(s) for the horizontal lines, e.g. 100, 200, 300, and for dates 2024/01/15, 2025/03/15
hLineColor: Select a color for line(s) and label(s)  (After color selection, click outside the control to apply)
horizontalLinelabel: Specify comma separated labels (no enclosing quotes) for the horizontal line(s)
horizontalLinelabel_angle_text: Angle to slant horizontal line label text (default 0 for no slanting)
label2: Note: Greater values move the text lower, smaller values move the text higher
xIntercept: Enter comma separated X intercept value(s) for vertical line(s), e.g. 100, 200, 300, and for dates 2024/01/15, 2025/03/15
vLineColor: Select a color for line(s) and label(s) (After color selection, click outside the control to apply)
verticalLinelabel: Specify comma separated labels (no enclosing quotes) for the vertical line(s)
verticalLinelabel_angle_text: Angle to slant vertical line label text (default 0 for no slanting)
label4: Note: greater values place the text to the left, smaller values move the text to the right
label5: Specify a range for X and Y axis values
rangeXValues: Specify the X axis range, for e.g. 0,100 or for date ranges 2024/01/15, 2025/03/15
rangeYValues: Specify the Y axis range, for e.g. 0,100 or for date ranges 2024/01/15, 2025/03/15
labelHori_HorizontalJustification: Note: greater values place the text to the left, smaller values move the text to the right
labelVeri_VerticalJustification: Note: Greater values move the text lower, smaller values move the text higher
verticalJustification: Control the vertical justification of the label
hori_HorizontalJustification: Control the horizontal justification of the label
horizontalJustification: Control the horizontal justification of the label
veri_VerticalJustification: Control the vertical justification of the label
addlLabelHlineTextPositionOffset: Additional adjustments to position the label text for horizontal lines
horiMovementHReflineLabel: Move text horzontally left or right - use any number with + or - sign
isHXaxisDateChk: Check this box if x-axis is in date or date time (the above number will be converted into number of days)
nobreaklineHRefLabelandValueChk: Check this box to remove the break line between label value and label text
vertiMovementHReflineLabel: Move text vertically up or down - use any number with + or - sign (leave 0 for Categorical axis)
isHYaxisDateChk: Check this box if y-axis is in date or date time (the above number will be converted into number of days)
addlLabelVlineTextPositionOffset: Additional adjustments to position the label text for horizontal lines
horiMovementVReflineLabel: Move text horzontally left or right - use any number with + or - sign
isVXaxisDateChk: Check this box if x-axis is in date or date time (the above number will be converted into number of days)
nobreaklineVRefLabelandValueChk: Check this box to remove the break line between label value and label text
vertiMovementVReflineLabel: Move text vertically up or down - use any number with + or - sign (leave 0 for Categorical axis)
isVYaxisDateChk: Check this box if y-axis is in date or date time (the above number will be converted into number of days)

help.title: Time Series Plot
help.body:
Description
Creates a plot, allows you to optionally group points by a factor variable, You can also optionally create facets, themes and specify a title and labels for the x and y axis. When multiple y variables are specified, a separate graph is drawn for every Y variable against the X variable.​
Usage
ggplot(data=Dataset,aes(x =var1,y=var2,color=var3,size=var4,alpha=var5,shape=var6)) + geom_point( position="jitter") + labs(x ="var1",y ="var2",color ="var3",title= "Scatter plot for ...")
Arguments
  • data: The default dataset​
  • aes():Generate aesthetic mappings that describe how variables in the data are mapped to visual properties (aesthetics) of geoms.
  • x: the numeric variable plotted on the x axis​
  • y: the numeric variable plotted on the y axis​
  • color: A factor variable to group points by. Each group is shown in a different color.​
  • size: a numeric variable that the size of the point is proportional to​
  • alpha: A numeric variable that the transparency of a point is proportional to​
  • geom_point():The point geom is used to create Plots.​
  • Labs(): Change axis labels and legend titles(This is optional)​
  • geom_smooth() : Adds a smoothed conditional mean(This is optional)​
  • facet_grid(): Lay out panels in a grid(This is optional)​
Package
ggplot2;ggthemes;
Help
help(geom_point, package=ggplot2)
Other: Click the R Help button to get detailed R help. You can also enter help(geom_point), help(labs), help(geom_smooth), help(aes), help(facet_grid), help(theme_excel)​

Date and Time Formatting Codes:

Year:
%Y: Full year (e.g., 2024).
%y: Last two digits of the year (e.g., 24 for 2024).

Month:
%m: Month as a zero-padded decimal number (e.g., 01 for January, 02 for February).
%b: Abbreviated month name (e.g., Jan, Feb, Mar).
%B: Full month name (e.g., January, February, March).

Day of the Month:
%d: Day of the month as a zero-padded decimal number (e.g., 01, 02, 03).
%-d: Day of the month as a decimal number without leading zeros (e.g., 1, 2, 3).

Day of the Week:
%a: Abbreviated weekday name (e.g., Mon, Tue, Wed).
%A: Full weekday name (e.g., Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday).
%u: Day of the week as a decimal number (1 = Monday, 7 = Sunday).
%w: Day of the week as a decimal number (0 = Sunday, 6 = Saturday).

Week of the Year:
%U: Week number of the year (starting with Sunday as the first day of the week) as a zero-padded decimal number (e.g., 01, 02).
%W: Week number of the year (starting with Monday as the first day of the week) as a zero-padded decimal number.

Hour:
%H: Hour (00–23, zero-padded).
%I: Hour (01–12, zero-padded, 12-hour clock).
%p: AM or PM indicator.
Minute:
%M: Minute as a zero-padded decimal number (e.g., 00, 01, 59).
Second:
%S: Second as a zero-padded decimal number (e.g., 00, 01, 59).
Time Zone:
%Z: Time zone abbreviation (e.g., UTC, EST).
%z: Offset from UTC (e.g., +0000, -0500).
Full Date/Time:
%c: Full date and time (e.g., Thu Sep 7 10:34:24 2023).
%x: Date representation (e.g., 09/07/23).
%X: Time representation (e.g., 10:34:24).

Examples: "%Y-%m-%d": Full date with year, month, and day (e.g., 2024-09-12).
"%A, %B %d, %Y": Full weekday, month name, day, and year (e.g., Thursday, September 12, 2024).
"%H:%M:%S": Time in 24-hour format (e.g., 14:05:30).
